te:
>> As a side question, is it ok to use DELETE when it 'clears
>> a list=
'. Say, I want to clear my shopping cart, so I delete it.
>> However, when =
I GET it later on, it simply says that it's empty
>> rather than it doesn't=
 exist.
>
> No. Don=92t overload the meaning of verbs to use them for
> =93=
something similar=94. DELETE has narrow semamtics; if your use
> does not p=
reserve them, then you should not be using DELETE.

He's not overloading th=
e meaning; DELETE requests the resource's
representations be removed, and t=
he server does that so is able to
respond 2xx to it.  Nothing says the serv=
er can't then immediately -
or at any time of its choosing - make new repre=
sentations of that
